alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Accomack and Northampton Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 403 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Bavon to Cape Charles. Movement was east to northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cheriton and Bay View around 410 PM EDT. Nassawadox around 430 PM EDT. Exmore and Willis Wharf around 435 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Capeville, Birdsnest, Silver Beach, Eastville, Machipongo, Wardtown, Franktown, Simpkins, Townsend and Oyster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
